Message.TypeName: Do not pass literals as localized parameters
Message.Issue: Method 'PrestaShopWebService.Parse(string)' passes a literal string as parameter 'format' of a call to 'Console.WriteLine(string, object)'. Retrieve the following string(s) from a resource table instead: "Parsed XML:\n{0}".
Correct the spelling of the unrecognized token 'parsable' in the literal '"HTTP XML response is not parsable: "'.

Add [Serializable] to 'PrestaShopWebserviceException' as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.TypeName: Do not pass literals as localized parameters
Rule.Name: Do not pass literals as localized parameters
Rule.Description: Literal strings that are embedded in source code are difficult to localize. Avoid passing literal strings as arguments in circumstances where a localized string is generally expected.
Rule.Resolution: Method {0} passes a literal string as parameter '{1}' of a call to {2}. Retrieve the following string(s) from a resource table instead: {3}.

Rule.Name: Implement standard exception constructors
Rule.Description: Multiple constructors are required to correctly implement a custom exception. Missing constructors can make your exception unusable in certain scenarios. For example, the serialization constructor is required for handling exceptions in XML Web services.

Rule.Name: Literals should be spelled correctly
Rule.Description: This rule parses the literal string into words, tokenizing compound words, and checks the spelling of each word/token.
Rule.Resolution: Correct the spelling of the unrecognized token '{0}' in the literal '{1}'.

Rule.Name: Mark ISerializable types with SerializableAttribute
Rule.Description: The System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable interface allows the type to customize its serialization, while the Serializable attribute enables the runtime to recognize the type as being serializable.
Rule.Resolution: Add [Serializable] to {0} as this type implements ISerializable.

Rule.Name: URI parameters should not be strings
Rule.Description: If a parameter name contains "uri" or "url" or "urn", and it's typed as string, the parameter type should be changed to System.Uri, unless there is an overload method where the same parameter is typed as System.Uri.
Rule.Resolution: Change the type of parameter {0} of method {1} from string to System.Uri, or provide an overload of {1}, that allows {0} to be passed as a System.Uri object.
